content.thinking: Got the feature info. Now check checklists.

input.command: grep -E '^\- \[([ Xx])\]' /home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/specs/035-ffi-filesystem/checklists/*.md 2>/dev/null | awk -F: '{file=$1; status=$2} {if(status ~ /\[x\]/ || status ~ /\[X\]/) completed++; total++} END {print "total=" total, "completed=" completed, "incomplete=" (total-completed)}'

content.thinking: Hmm, the grep pattern didn't capture completed items correctly. Let me try a different approach.

input.command: cd /home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/specs/035-ffi-filesystem/checklists && for f in *.md; do total=$(grep -cE '^\- \[' "$f" 2>/dev/null || echo 0); completed=$(grep -ciE '^\- \[x\]' "$f" 2>/dev/null || echo 0); incomplete=$((total - completed)); echo "$f: total=$total completed=$completed incomplete=$incomplete"; done

content.thinking: Good, all checklist items are complete. Now let me proceed.

content.content:
1# Tasks: FFI Filesystem Access
     2
     3**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/035-ffi-filesystem/`
     4**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5**Constitution**: TDD is REQUIRED - write tests first, verify they fail, then implement
     6
     7## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
     8
     9- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    10- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (US1-US5)
    11- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    12
    13## User Stories Summary
    14
    15| ID | Title | Priority | Components |
    16|----|-------|----------|------------|
    17| US1 | Read File Contents | P1 | `read-file-contents` function |
    18| US2 | Write File Contents | P1 | `write-file-contents` function |
    19| US3 | Safe File Handling | P2 | `with-open-file` macro |
    20| US4 | Open/Close Handles | P2 | `open-file`, `close-file` functions |
    21| US5 | Cross-Platform | P3 | Host shims (WASI + Virtual FS) |
    22
    23---
    24
    25## Phase 1: Setup
    26
    27**Purpose**: Project initialization and module structure
    28
    29- [x] T001 Create filesystem package definition in src/clysm/filesystem/package.lisp
    30- [x] T002 [P] Add filesystem module to clysm.asd system definition
    31- [x] T003 [P] Create test directory structure tests/unit/filesystem/, tests/contract/, tests/integration/
    32
    33---
    34
    35## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    36
    37**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented
    38
    39** CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete
    40
    41### Tests for Foundation
    42
    43- [x] T004 [P] Unit test for file-error condition in tests/unit/filesystem/file-error-test.lisp
    44- [x] T005 [P] Unit test for file-stream struct in tests/unit/filesystem/file-stream-test.lisp
    45- [x] T006 [P] Contract test for FFI imports in tests/contract/filesystem-ffi-test.lisp
    46
    47### Implementation for Foundation
    48
    49- [x] T007 [P] Define file-error condition class in src/clysm/conditions/types.lisp
    50- [x] T008 [P] Define file-stream struct in src/clysm/filesystem/types.lisp
    51- [x] T009 [P] Declare FFI imports (%open-file, %close-file, %read-all, %write-all) in src/clysm/filesystem/ffi.lisp
    52- [x] T010 Create base host shim structure in host-shim/fs-shim.js with getImports() skeleton
    53
    54**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin
    55
    56---
    57
    58## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Read File Contents (Priority: P1)  MVP
    59
    60**Goal**: A Lisp programmer reads the entire contents of a file by specifying a filename and receives the contents as a string.
    61
    62**Independent Test**: Create a test file with known contents, call `read-file-contents`, verify returned string matches.
    63
    64### Tests for User Story 1
    65
    66> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    67
    68- [x] T011 [P] [US1] Unit test read-file-contents with pathname in tests/unit/filesystem/read-contents-test.lisp
    69- [x] T012 [P] [US1] Unit test read-file-contents with file-stream in tests/unit/filesystem/read-contents-test.lisp
    70- [x] T013 [P] [US1] Unit test read-file-contents UTF-8 encoding in tests/unit/filesystem/read-contents-test.lisp
    71- [x] T014 [P] [US1] Unit test read-file-contents file-not-found error in tests/unit/filesystem/read-contents-test.lisp
    72
    73### Implementation for User Story 1
    74
    75- [x] T015 [US1] Implement read-file-contents function (pathname variant) in src/clysm/filesystem/read.lisp
    76- [x] T016 [US1] Implement read-file-contents function (stream variant) in src/clysm/filesystem/read.lisp
    77- [x] T017 [US1] Add UTF-8 decoding for file contents using babel in src/clysm/filesystem/read.lisp
    78- [x] T018 [US1] Implement host shim fs.read-all function in host-shim/fs-shim.js (completed in T010)
    79
    80**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - `read-file-contents` works for both pathname and stream inputs
    81
    82---
    83
    84## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Write File Contents (Priority: P1)
    85
    86**Goal**: A Lisp programmer writes a string to a file, creating the file if it doesn't exist or overwriting if it does.
    87
    88**Independent Test**: Write a string to a file, then read it back and verify contents match.
    89
    90### Tests for User Story 2
    91
    92- [x] T019 [P] [US2] Unit test write-file-contents with pathname in tests/unit/filesystem/write-contents-test.lisp
    93- [x] T020 [P] [US2] Unit test write-file-contents with file-stream in tests/unit/filesystem/write-contents-test.lisp
    94- [x] T021 [P] [US2] Unit test write-file-contents UTF-8 encoding in tests/unit/filesystem/write-contents-test.lisp
    95- [x] T022 [P] [US2] Unit test write-file-contents directory-not-found error in tests/unit/filesystem/write-contents-test.lisp
    96
    97### Implementation for User Story 2
    98
    99- [x] T023 [US2] Implement write-file-contents function (pathname variant) in src/clysm/filesystem/write.lisp
   100- [x] T024 [US2] Implement write-file-contents function (stream variant) in src/clysm/filesystem/write.lisp
   101- [x] T025 [US2] Add UTF-8 encoding for file contents using babel in src/clysm/filesystem/write.lisp
   102- [x] T026 [US2] Implement host shim fs.write-all function in host-shim/fs-shim.js (completed in T010)
   103
   104**Checkpoint**: User Stories 1 & 2 complete - basic file read/write works
   105
   106---
   107
   108## Phase 5: User Story 4 - Open and Close File Handles (Priority: P2)
   109
   110**Goal**: A Lisp programmer explicitly opens a file, performs multiple operations, and closes it for fine-grained control.
   111
   112**Independent Test**: Open a file, verify handle is valid, close it, verify operations on closed handle signal error.
   113
   114**Note**: Implemented before US3 because `with-open-file` depends on `open-file` and `close-file`.
   115
   116### Tests for User Story 4
   117
   118- [x] T027 [P] [US4] Unit test open-file input existing file in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
   119- [x] T028 [P] [US4] Unit test open-file input not-found error in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
   120- [x] T029 [P] [US4] Unit test open-file output create file in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
   121- [x] T030 [P] [US4] Unit test open-file :if-exists :error in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
   122- [x] T031 [P] [US4] Unit test close-file success in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
   123- [x] T032 [P] [US4] Unit test close-file already-closed error in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
   124
   125### Implementation for User Story 4
   126
   127- [x] T033 [US4] Implement open-file function with :direction parameter in src/clysm/filesystem/open.lisp
   128- [x] T034 [US4] Implement open-file :if-exists and :if-does-not-exist parameters in src/clysm/filesystem/open.lisp
   129- [x] T035 [US4] Implement close-file function in src/clysm/filesystem/open.lisp
   130- [x] T036 [US4] Implement host shim fs.open function in host-shim/fs-shim.js (completed in T010)
   131- [x] T037 [US4] Implement host shim fs.close function in host-shim/fs-shim.js (completed in T010)
   132
   133**Checkpoint**: User Story 4 complete - explicit file handle management works
   134
   135---
   136
   137## Phase 6: User Story 3 - Safe File Handling (Priority: P2)
   138
   139**Goal**: A Lisp programmer uses the `with-open-file` macro to ensure files are properly closed even when errors occur.
   140
   141**Independent Test**: Use `with-open-file`, throw an error within the body, verify the file is still properly closed.
   142
   143### Tests for User Story 3
   144
   145- [x] T038 [P] [US3] Unit test with-open-file normal completion in tests/unit/filesystem/with-open-file-test.lisp
   146- [x] T039 [P] [US3] Unit test with-open-file error propagation with cleanup in tests/unit/filesystem/with-open-file-test.lisp
   147- [x] T040 [P] [US3] Unit test with-open-file input direction in tests/unit/filesystem/with-open-file-test.lisp
   148- [x] T041 [P] [US3] Unit test with-open-file output direction in tests/unit/filesystem/with-open-file-test.lisp
   149
   150### Implementation for User Story 3
   151
   152- [x] T042 [US3] Implement with-open-file macro using unwind-protect in src/clysm/filesystem/macros.lisp
   153- [x] T043 [US3] Add keyword argument parsing for :direction, :if-exists, :if-does-not-exist in src/clysm/filesystem/macros.lisp
   154
   155**Checkpoint**: User Story 3 complete - safe resource management with automatic cleanup works
   156
   157---
   158
   159## Phase 7: User Story 5 - Cross-Platform File Access (Priority: P3)
   160
   161**Goal**: File I/O code works identically on wasmtime (WASI) and browser (Virtual FS) environments.
   162
   163**Independent Test**: Run the same file operations in both environments and verify identical behavior.
   164
   165### Tests for User Story 5
   166
   167- [x] T044 [P] [US5] Contract test Wasm module validates with clysm:fs imports in tests/contract/filesystem-wasm-test.lisp
   168- [x] T045 [P] [US5] Integration test file operations on wasmtime in tests/integration/filesystem-test.lisp
   169- [x] T046 [P] [US5] Integration test file operations on browser (mocked) in tests/integration/filesystem-test.lisp
   170
   171### Implementation for User Story 5
   172
   173- [x] T047 [US5] Implement WASI Preview2 backend in host-shim/wasi-filesystem.js (uses Node.js fs module in fs-shim.js)
   174- [ ] T048 [US5] Implement Virtual FS backend in host-shim/virtual-fs.js (DEFERRED - requires browser testing)
   175- [x] T049 [US5] Add environment detection and backend selection in host-shim/fs-shim.js
   176- [x] T050 [US5] Ensure file-error conditions include environment-specific details in src/clysm/filesystem/errors.lisp (pathname in file-error)
   177
   178**Checkpoint**: All user stories complete - cross-platform file I/O works
   179
   180---
   181
   182## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   183
   184**Purpose**: Final validation and cleanup
   185
   186- [x] T051 [P] Run all unit tests via `rove tests/unit/filesystem/` (passed)
   187- [x] T052 [P] Run contract tests via `rove tests/contract/filesystem-ffi-test.lisp` (passed)
   188- [x] T053 [P] Run integration tests via `rove tests/integration/filesystem-test.lisp` (included in test suite)
   189- [x] T054 Validate Wasm output with `wasm-tools validate` for compiled filesystem operations (via test suite)
   190- [x] T055 [P] Run quickstart.md validation examples (basic implementation verified)
   191- [x] T056 Update CLAUDE.md with Feature 035 completion status
   192- [ ] T057 Run `nix flake check` to verify all tests pass (deferred - pre-existing test failures)
   193
   194---
   195
   196## Dependencies & Execution Order
   197
   198### Phase Dependencies
   199
   200```
   201Phase 1: Setup
   202    
   203Phase 2: Foundational (BLOCKS all user stories)
   204    
   205     Phase 3: US1 Read File Contents (P1)  MVP
   206     Phase 4: US2 Write File Contents (P1)
   207    
   208Phase 5: US4 Open/Close Handles (P2)
   209    
   210Phase 6: US3 with-open-file (P2) [depends on US4]
   211    
   212Phase 7: US5 Cross-Platform (P3)
   213    
   214Phase 8: Polish
   215```
   216
   217### User Story Dependencies
   218
   219| Story | Depends On | Notes |
   220|-------|------------|-------|
   221| US1 (Read) | Foundation | Can start immediately after Phase 2 |
   222| US2 (Write) | Foundation | Can run in parallel with US1 |
   223| US4 (Open/Close) | US1, US2 | Exposes public API for file handles |
   224| US3 (with-open-file) | US4 | Uses open-file/close-file internally |
   225| US5 (Cross-Platform) | US1-US4 | Validates all operations on both backends |
   226
   227### Within Each User Story
   228
   2291. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation
   2302. Implementation follows test order
   2313. Story complete before moving to dependent stories
   232
   233### Parallel Opportunities
   234
   235**Phase 2 (Foundation)**: T004-T006 tests in parallel, then T007-T010 implementation in parallel
   236
   237**US1**: T011-T014 tests in parallel, then T015-T018 sequentially
   238
   239**US2**: T019-T022 tests in parallel, then T023-T026 sequentially
   240
   241**US4**: T027-T032 tests in parallel, then T033-T037 sequentially
   242
   243**US3**: T038-T041 tests in parallel, then T042-T043 sequentially
   244
   245**US5**: T044-T046 tests in parallel, then T047-T050 sequentially
   246
   247---
   248
   249## Parallel Example: Foundation Phase
   250
   251```bash
   252# Launch all foundation tests together:
   253Task: "Unit test for file-error condition" [T004]
   254Task: "Unit test for file-stream struct" [T005]
   255Task: "Contract test for FFI imports" [T006]
   256
   257# After tests fail, launch all foundation implementations together:
   258Task: "Define file-error condition class" [T007]
   259Task: "Define file-stream struct" [T008]
   260Task: "Declare FFI imports" [T009]
   261```
   262
   263---
   264
   265## Implementation Strategy
   266
   267### MVP First (US1 Only)
   268
   2691. Complete Phase 1: Setup
   2702. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
   2713. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (Read File Contents)
   2724. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test `(read-file-contents "test.txt")` independently
   2735. Can deploy/demo with read-only file access
   274
   275### Incremental Delivery
   276
   2771. Setup + Foundation  Infrastructure ready
   2782. Add US1  Read works  Demo: config loading
   2793. Add US2  Write works  Demo: log output
   2804. Add US4  Explicit handles  Demo: multi-operation workflows
   2815. Add US3  Safe cleanup  Demo: error-resilient code
   2826. Add US5  Cross-platform  Demo: browser execution
   283
   284---
   285
   286## Notes
   287
   288- **TDD Required**: Constitution mandates test-first development
   289- **[P] tasks**: Different files, no dependencies - can run in parallel
   290- **[Story] label**: Maps task to user story for traceability
   291- **UTF-8 Only**: No other encodings supported (per research.md)
   292- **Whole-file ops**: No line-by-line I/O (per research.md decision)
   293- **Commit**: After each task or logical group
   294- **Validate**: Run `wasm-tools validate` after any compilation task
   295

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: FFI Filesystem Access

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/035-ffi-filesystem/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
**Constitution**: TDD is REQUIRED - write tests first, verify they fail, then implement

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (US1-US5)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

## User Stories Summary

| ID | Title | Priority | Components |
|----|-------|----------|------------|
| US1 | Read File Contents | P1 | `read-file-contents` function |
| US2 | Write File Contents | P1 | `write-file-contents` function |
| US3 | Safe File Handling | P2 | `with-open-file` macro |
| US4 | Open/Close Handles | P2 | `open-file`, `close-file` functions |
| US5 | Cross-Platform | P3 | Host shims (WASI + Virtual FS) |

---

## Phase 1: Setup

**Purpose**: Project initialization and module structure

- [x] T001 Create filesystem package definition in src/clysm/filesystem/package.lisp
- [x] T002 [P] Add filesystem module to clysm.asd system definition
- [x] T003 [P] Create test directory structure tests/unit/filesystem/, tests/contract/, tests/integration/

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented

** CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

### Tests for Foundation

- [x] T004 [P] Unit test for file-error condition in tests/unit/filesystem/file-error-test.lisp
- [x] T005 [P] Unit test for file-stream struct in tests/unit/filesystem/file-stream-test.lisp
- [x] T006 [P] Contract test for FFI imports in tests/contract/filesystem-ffi-test.lisp

### Implementation for Foundation

- [x] T007 [P] Define file-error condition class in src/clysm/conditions/types.lisp
- [x] T008 [P] Define file-stream struct in src/clysm/filesystem/types.lisp
- [x] T009 [P] Declare FFI imports (%open-file, %close-file, %read-all, %write-all) in src/clysm/filesystem/ffi.lisp
- [x] T010 Create base host shim structure in host-shim/fs-shim.js with getImports() skeleton

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Read File Contents (Priority: P1)  MVP

**Goal**: A Lisp programmer reads the entire contents of a file by specifying a filename and receives the contents as a string.

**Independent Test**: Create a test file with known contents, call `read-file-contents`, verify returned string matches.

### Tests for User Story 1

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [x] T011 [P] [US1] Unit test read-file-contents with pathname in tests/unit/filesystem/read-contents-test.lisp
- [x] T012 [P] [US1] Unit test read-file-contents with file-stream in tests/unit/filesystem/read-contents-test.lisp
- [x] T013 [P] [US1] Unit test read-file-contents UTF-8 encoding in tests/unit/filesystem/read-contents-test.lisp
- [x] T014 [P] [US1] Unit test read-file-contents file-not-found error in tests/unit/filesystem/read-contents-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [x] T015 [US1] Implement read-file-contents function (pathname variant) in src/clysm/filesystem/read.lisp
- [x] T016 [US1] Implement read-file-contents function (stream variant) in src/clysm/filesystem/read.lisp
- [x] T017 [US1] Add UTF-8 decoding for file contents using babel in src/clysm/filesystem/read.lisp
- [x] T018 [US1] Implement host shim fs.read-all function in host-shim/fs-shim.js (completed in T010)

**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - `read-file-contents` works for both pathname and stream inputs

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Write File Contents (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: A Lisp programmer writes a string to a file, creating the file if it doesn't exist or overwriting if it does.

**Independent Test**: Write a string to a file, then read it back and verify contents match.

### Tests for User Story 2

- [x] T019 [P] [US2] Unit test write-file-contents with pathname in tests/unit/filesystem/write-contents-test.lisp
- [x] T020 [P] [US2] Unit test write-file-contents with file-stream in tests/unit/filesystem/write-contents-test.lisp
- [x] T021 [P] [US2] Unit test write-file-contents UTF-8 encoding in tests/unit/filesystem/write-contents-test.lisp
- [x] T022 [P] [US2] Unit test write-file-contents directory-not-found error in tests/unit/filesystem/write-contents-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [x] T023 [US2] Implement write-file-contents function (pathname variant) in src/clysm/filesystem/write.lisp
- [x] T024 [US2] Implement write-file-contents function (stream variant) in src/clysm/filesystem/write.lisp
- [x] T025 [US2] Add UTF-8 encoding for file contents using babel in src/clysm/filesystem/write.lisp
- [x] T026 [US2] Implement host shim fs.write-all function in host-shim/fs-shim.js (completed in T010)

**Checkpoint**: User Stories 1 & 2 complete - basic file read/write works

---

## Phase 5: User Story 4 - Open and Close File Handles (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: A Lisp programmer explicitly opens a file, performs multiple operations, and closes it for fine-grained control.

**Independent Test**: Open a file, verify handle is valid, close it, verify operations on closed handle signal error.

**Note**: Implemented before US3 because `with-open-file` depends on `open-file` and `close-file`.

### Tests for User Story 4

- [x] T027 [P] [US4] Unit test open-file input existing file in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
- [x] T028 [P] [US4] Unit test open-file input not-found error in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
- [x] T029 [P] [US4] Unit test open-file output create file in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
- [x] T030 [P] [US4] Unit test open-file :if-exists :error in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
- [x] T031 [P] [US4] Unit test close-file success in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp
- [x] T032 [P] [US4] Unit test close-file already-closed error in tests/unit/filesystem/open-close-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 4

- [x] T033 [US4] Implement open-file function with :direction parameter in src/clysm/filesystem/open.lisp
- [x] T034 [US4] Implement open-file :if-exists and :if-does-not-exist parameters in src/clysm/filesystem/open.lisp
- [x] T035 [US4] Implement close-file function in src/clysm/filesystem/open.lisp
- [x] T036 [US4] Implement host shim fs.open function in host-shim/fs-shim.js (completed in T010)
- [x] T037 [US4] Implement host shim fs.close function in host-shim/fs-shim.js (completed in T010)

**Checkpoint**: User Story 4 complete - explicit file handle management works

---

## Phase 6: User Story 3 - Safe File Handling (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: A Lisp programmer uses the `with-open-file` macro to ensure files are properly closed even when errors occur.

**Independent Test**: Use `with-open-file`, throw an error within the body, verify the file is still properly closed.

### Tests for User Story 3

- [x] T038 [P] [US3] Unit test with-open-file normal completion in tests/unit/filesystem/with-open-file-test.lisp
- [x] T039 [P] [US3] Unit test with-open-file error propagation with cleanup in tests/unit/filesystem/with-open-file-test.lisp
- [x] T040 [P] [US3] Unit test with-open-file input direction in tests/unit/filesystem/with-open-file-test.lisp
- [x] T041 [P] [US3] Unit test with-open-file output direction in tests/unit/filesystem/with-open-file-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 3

- [x] T042 [US3] Implement with-open-file macro using unwind-protect in src/clysm/filesystem/macros.lisp
- [x] T043 [US3] Add keyword argument parsing for :direction, :if-exists, :if-does-not-exist in src/clysm/filesystem/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: User Story 3 complete - safe resource management with automatic cleanup works

---

## Phase 7: User Story 5 - Cross-Platform File Access (Priority: P3)

**Goal**: File I/O code works identically on wasmtime (WASI) and browser (Virtual FS) environments.

**Independent Test**: Run the same file operations in both environments and verify identical behavior.

### Tests for User Story 5

- [x] T044 [P] [US5] Contract test Wasm module validates with clysm:fs imports in tests/contract/filesystem-wasm-test.lisp
- [x] T045 [P] [US5] Integration test file operations on wasmtime in tests/integration/filesystem-test.lisp
- [x] T046 [P] [US5] Integration test file operations on browser (mocked) in tests/integration/filesystem-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 5

- [x] T047 [US5] Implement WASI Preview2 backend in host-shim/wasi-filesystem.js (uses Node.js fs module in fs-shim.js)
- [ ] T048 [US5] Implement Virtual FS backend in host-shim/virtual-fs.js (DEFERRED - requires browser testing)
- [x] T049 [US5] Add environment detection and backend selection in host-shim/fs-shim.js
- [x] T050 [US5] Ensure file-error conditions include environment-specific details in src/clysm/filesystem/errors.lisp (pathname in file-error)

**Checkpoint**: All user stories complete - cross-platform file I/O works

---

## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Final validation and cleanup

- [x] T051 [P] Run all unit tests via `rove tests/unit/filesystem/` (passed)
- [x] T052 [P] Run contract tests via `rove tests/contract/filesystem-ffi-test.lisp` (passed)
- [x] T053 [P] Run integration tests via `rove tests/integration/filesystem-test.lisp` (included in test suite)
- [x] T054 Validate Wasm output with `wasm-tools validate` for compiled filesystem operations (via test suite)
- [x] T055 [P] Run quickstart.md validation examples (basic implementation verified)
- [x] T056 Update CLAUDE.md with Feature 035 completion status
- [ ] T057 Run `nix flake check` to verify all tests pass (deferred - pre-existing test failures)

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

```
Phase 1: Setup
    
Phase 2: Foundational (BLOCKS all user stories)
    
     Phase 3: US1 Read File Contents (P1)  MVP
     Phase 4: US2 Write File Contents (P1)
    
Phase 5: US4 Open/Close Handles (P2)
    
Phase 6: US3 with-open-file (P2) [depends on US4]
    
Phase 7: US5 Cross-Platform (P3)
    
Phase 8: Polish
```

### User Story Dependencies

| Story | Depends On | Notes |
|-------|------------|-------|
| US1 (Read) | Foundation | Can start immediately after Phase 2 |
| US2 (Write) | Foundation | Can run in parallel with US1 |
| US4 (Open/Close) | US1, US2 | Exposes public API for file handles |
| US3 (with-open-file) | US4 | Uses open-file/close-file internally |
| US5 (Cross-Platform) | US1-US4 | Validates all operations on both backends |

### Within Each User Story

1. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation
2. Implementation follows test order
3. Story complete before moving to dependent stories

### Parallel Opportunities

**Phase 2 (Foundation)**: T004-T006 tests in parallel, then T007-T010 implementation in parallel

**US1**: T011-T014 tests in parallel, then T015-T018 sequentially

**US2**: T019-T022 tests in parallel, then T023-T026 sequentially

**US4**: T027-T032 tests in parallel, then T033-T037 sequentially

**US3**: T038-T041 tests in parallel, then T042-T043 sequentially

**US5**: T044-T046 tests in parallel, then T047-T050 sequentially

---

## Parallel Example: Foundation Phase

```bash
# Launch all foundation tests together:
Task: "Unit test for file-error condition" [T004]
Task: "Unit test for file-stream struct" [T005]
Task: "Contract test for FFI imports" [T006]

# After tests fail, launch all foundation implementations together:
Task: "Define file-error condition class" [T007]
Task: "Define file-stream struct" [T008]
Task: "Declare FFI imports" [T009]
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (US1 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (Read File Contents)
4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test `(read-file-contents "test.txt")` independently
5. Can deploy/demo with read-only file access

### Incremental Delivery

1. Setup + Foundation  Infrastructure ready
2. Add US1  Read works  Demo: config loading
3. Add US2  Write works  Demo: log output
4. Add US4  Explicit handles  Demo: multi-operation workflows
5. Add US3  Safe cleanup  Demo: error-resilient code
6. Add US5  Cross-platform  Demo: browser execution

---

## Notes

- **TDD Required**: Constitution mandates test-first development
- **[P] tasks**: Different files, no dependencies - can run in parallel
- **[Story] label**: Maps task to user story for traceability
- **UTF-8 Only**: No other encodings supported (per research.md)
- **Whole-file ops**: No line-by-line I/O (per research.md decision)
- **Commit**: After each task or logical group
- **Validate**: Run `wasm-tools validate` after any compilation task
